Name: General Sir Nicholas Houghton
Job/Team Function: The Chief of the Defence Staff (CDS) is the professional head of the British Armed Forces and the most senior uniformed military adviser to the Secretary of State for Defence and the Prime Minister.

Name: Air Chief Marshal Sir Stuart Peach
Job Title: Vice Chief of the Defence Staff
Job/Team Function: VCDS deputises for CDS (in particular as Military Strategic Commander). Co-ordinating delivery of top-level decisions-making, implementation and monitoring progress. Leading senior military judgement for the future development of the Armed Forces including the definition and delivery for military capability requirements; and being capability sponsor for capital projects and programmes.

Name: Jon Thompson
Job/Team Function: The Permanent Secretary is the Head of the Civil Service in the Department and carries responsibility for the strategy, performance, reform, organisation and the finances of the MoD.  The role works closely with the Chief of the Defence Staff in leading the organisation and supporting Ministers in the conduct of business in the Department across the full range of responsibilities.

Name: Graeme Biggar
Job Title: Secretary of State Chief of Staff
Job/Team Function: The Chief of Staff to the Defence Secretary is responsible for driving forward progress on the Secretary of State’s top priorities of the moment and lead on the following discrete subject areas: relations with the US, nuclear matters, strategic intelligence and senior staff appointments.

Name: N/D
Job Title: Chief of the Defence Staff Principal Staff Officer
Job/Team Function: Provide brefing and decision support to CDS in his capacity as the Strategic commander for the UK military operations, professional head of the Armed Forces and the principal military adviser to the Secretary of State for Defence and the Prime Minister.

Name: N/D
Job Title: Permanent Under Secretary Chief of Staff
Job/Team Function: To support the Permanent Secretary in leading the MOD, ensuring the PUS has thorough understanding of the performance of the organisation and plans for change and transformation.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: The General Law Division advises ministers, senior policy and military personnel on a wide range of legal issues including: public inquiries (including Iraq; Gibson; Al Sweady and Northern Ireland inquiries);  inquests; human rights issues; the doctrine o

Name: N/D
Job Title: Head of Command, Discipline & Constitutional Division
Job/Team Function: The work of the Command, Discipline & Constitutional Division includes working on the Armed Forces Bill and on subordinate legislation and working closely with other Government Departments where MOD legislation affects an OGD, or an OGD proposes legislati

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Defence Intellectual Property is responsible for MOD intellectual property Policy.  It manages the Departments Crown Copyright delegation from the Office of Public Sector Information, files and manages the MoDs portfolio of Patents, trademarks, and Design

Job/Team Function: Legal branch of the Sovereign Base Areas Administration

Name: Alfred Hitchcock
Job Title: Chief Constable of the Ministry of Defence Police
Job/Team Function: The MDP Chief Constable is responsible for the delivery of effective Policing and Guarding in support of the UK's Defence capability. The focus of all MDPGA activity is to counter the main crime and security risks faced by the MOD: Terrorist attack and the threat of attack: disruption and disorder caused by protestors; theft of key assets; major financial fraud; and unauthorised intrusion onto the Defence Estate

Name: N/D
Job Title: Deputy Chief Constable of the Ministry of Defence Police
Job/Team Function: The Deputy Chief Constable MDP is responsible for the delivery of operational civilian policing services to MOD establishments in the UK, both military and civilian, inclusive of armed guarding and support to national critical infrastructure, contributing to international policing in countries such as Afghanistan where the MDP help develop and deliver human rights-based local policing, training and mentoring local recruits

Name: N/D
Job Title: Head of Corporate Services Ministry of Defence Police
Job/Team Function: The Head of Corporate Services is responsible for providing Financial, Secretarial, Parliamentary and other Corporate Service support and advice to the Chief Constable of the MDPGA and other senior colleagues

Name: N/D
Job Title: British Defence Staff United States - Air Attaché
Job/Team Function: Performs the duties of both the Air Attaché and the Assistant Defence Attaché in Washington. Provides Her Majesty’s Ambassador and the Defence Attaché with specialist advice on all air, space and cyberspace power matters. Responsibilities include playing a key role in fostering close engagement with the air arms of each of the US Forces, in particular their air, space and cyberspace related elements. Ensuring maximum interoperability between the UK and US Armed Forces, so that when the UK undertakes any form of military operation with the US we can operate together efficiently, effectively and with trust.

Name: R Adm Mark Beverstock
Job Title: Assistant Chief of Defence Staff (Nuclear, Chemical and Biological)
Job/Team Function: formulation of strategic planning advice to COS and ministers, MOD’s 2* policy lead for CBRN, and Arms, Counter Proliferation.

Name: AVM Edward Stringer
Job/Team Function: Operational strategy and planning; direction and conduct of operations at the strategic level; maintenance of policy context for planning and conduct of operations; Defence Crisis Management Organisation process;Joint Capability; Middle East/Central America/South America (inc Peru, Colombia, Ecuador, Venezuela)

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Responsible for the management and direction of a team of civilian and military staff organized as a Defence Equipment team, a Science and Technology team and a Command, Control, Communications, Computers, Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance (C4ISR) team. Together their responsibilities include: support to operations; delivery of a step change in the US-UK science and technology relationship; development of the US-UK Bilateral Defence Acquisition Committee; support to UK capability procurement and development; and support to UKTI objectives for the US.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function:
Responsible for management and direction of a civilian and military staff organized as a Defence Policy Team and a Nuclear Strategic Deterrent and Chemical Biological and Radiological Defence (NSD & CBRD) Team. The Defence Policy Team promotes cooperation and dialogue with the
US defence community on strategic defence and national security issues and supports policy work on current military operations issues. The NSD & CBRD Team supports US/UK collaboration on nuclear deterrence; weapon stockpile reduction, testing and compliance and threat reduction; as well as, collaboration on chemical, biological, radiological,nuclear defence; and dialogue on ballistic missile defence.

Name: Lt Gen Gordon Messenger
Job Title: Deputy Chief of Defence Staff (Military Strategy and Operations)
Job/Team Function: Director of Operations. Joint responsibility (with DG Sec Pol for delivering strategy and planning for operations, directs and conducts operations at the strategic level)

Name: N/D

Job/Team Function: The Military Attaché provides Army-focused, military advice to Her Majesty’s Ambassador and the Defence Attaché and is the representative in the United States of the Chief of the General Staff of the British Army, providing an essential link at the highest level between the U.S. Army and the British Army.

Name: N/D
Job Title: British Defence Staff United States - Minister (Defence Materiel)
Job/Team Function: The senior Ministry of Defence Civil Servant in the United States. As Civil Secretary, he has responsibility for financial management governance of the BDS-US budget. As Minister (Defence Materiel), he is responsible to HMA for all aspects of the UK/US defence equipment acquisition, technology and logistics policy, programmes and process.

Name: N/D
Job Title: British Defence Staff United States - Naval Attaché
Job/Team Function: The Naval Attaché and his staff act as the principal advisers on maritime matters to Her Majesty's Ambassador and the Defence Attaché; represent the Royal Navy and Ministry of Defence (Navy) in the US; act as principal points of contact between the UK Ministry of Defence and the US Chief of Naval Operations, US Marine Corps and the US Coast Guard Service; and oversee arrangements for Royal Navy ships visits to the US.

Name: N/D
Job Title: Ops Directorate - Head Afghanistan, Pakistan, Iraq and Syria Policy
Job/Team Function: Operational strategy and planning; direction and conduct of operations at the strategic level; maintenance of policy context for planning and conduct of operations. Afghanistan Policy Matters

Responsibilities include sustaining collective oversight of the bilateral Defence relationship with the USA and all related MOD activity. Pursuing objectives and priorities endorsed by DG Sec Pol.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Produce Defence Operational Lessons and conduct Audit of Defence capability

Job/Team Function: Delivery of global military strategic planning; development of  security co-operation, conflict prevention and security sector reform in the Levant, Sub-Saharan Africa, South and South East Asia; recruit, direct and support worldwide Defence Attaché and Loan Service network

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Policy advice directed at promoting the UK’s security interests through the EU and with wider European partners.

Name: Lt Gen Mark Poffley
Job Title: Deputy Chief of Defence Staff (Military Capability)
Job/Team Function: DCDS(Mil Cap) acts as an identifiable, responsible and strong Capability Sponsor across the MOD Unified Customer in order to deliver capability that meets the endorsed requirements. Priority is given to current operations (particularly Afghanistan) exploiting both Equipment Plan and Urgent Operational Requirement processes. DCDS(Mil Cap)s other key objective is to generate and implement an affordable, balanced and coherent Equipment and Equipment Support Plan which is realistic and has agility. DCDS(Mil Cap) chairs the Military Capabilities Board (MCB).

Name: R Adm Graeme MacKay
Job/Team Function: D Carrier Strike (D CS) is a member of the MCB and the Senior Responsible Owner (SRO) for Carrier Strike (CS). D CS is amember of the Navy Board as the Controller of the Navy.

Name: R Adm Tim Fraser
Job Title: Assistant Chief of Defence Staff (Capability & Force Design)
Job/Team Function: ACDS(C&FD) is a member of the MCB leading on coherence across all the Defence Lines of Development, force structure and performance management

Name: Ian Forber
Job/Team Function: D Strat Prog is a member of the MCB and SRO for the Nuclear Capability. He is also responsible to the MCB for the manaagement and coorination of Complex Weapons, Test & Evaluation and capability assurance and protection.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Responsible for the management of the Carrier Strike programme office and Defence-wide capability solutions related to the Carrier Strike programme.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Responsible for the delivery of Defence-wide capability solutions to the MCB related to facilities to test, evaluate and develop cost-effective military capability. Also responsible for capability planning and coherence of the Complex Weapons portfolio, capability assurance and protection.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Responsible for the delivery of a UK operationally independent, continuous and invulnerable strategic nuclear deterrent; providing support to the Senior Responsible Officer for the deterrent and ensure's that the many projects in the deterrent area are managed as a coherent programme.

Job Title: Head Fin Mil Cap Joint Plans
Job/Team Function: Resource planning and capability coherence for Joint Forces Command and Head Office

Job/Team Function: Responsible for overall capability coherence, force structure and performance management

Job/Team Function: Responsible for the delivery of Defence-wide capability solutions to the MCB related to facilities to test, evaluate and develop cost-effective military capability. Also responsible for capability planning and coherence of the Complex Weapons portfolio, capability assurance and protection.

Job Title: Head Policy and Resources Saudi Armed Forces Projects
Job/Team Function: Policy & Secretariat

Name: N/D
Job Title: Head Contracts Saudi Armed Forces Projects

Job Title: Head Programmes Saudi Armed Forces Projects
Job/Team Function: Military Representative

Name: Air Marshal Ian Morrison
Job Title: Director General MOD Saudi Armed Forces Projects
Job/Team Function: Military Representative

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Responsible for the strategic direction of the Science & Technology (S&T) programme, setting the S&T strategy, policy and ensuring S&T programme delivers the direct benefits to defence, including Assurance and Evaluation programmes.  Develops and implements S&T solutions in response to Defence Reform in the MOD.  Oversees the MOD’s S&T wider Engagment programme.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Oversees technical programmes to deal with emerging Chemical Biological Radiological Nuclear (CBRN) and strategic Missile Defence threats.Through MOD's International Reseach Collaborations, ensures the UK participates fully in strategic partnerships and that UK interests are represented.

Name: Dr Paul Hollinshead
Job/Team Function: Provides advice to Ministers/senior officials on Defence S&T. Supports the Defence Research & Development (R&D) Board in defining the Science & Technology (S&T) strategy/policy to effectively manage the Research Programme. Identifies more cost effective options for military capability, so investment brings maximum benefit to UK Armed Forces. Oversees the delivery of MOD’s S&T requirement by Dstl and ensures Dstl creates mutually beneficial relationships with Defence research and technology suppliers. Responsible for delivery of MOD’s nuclear warhead and propulsion research programmes, including specific responsibilities as Senior Responsible Owner and central customer for the Nuclear Warhead Capability Sustainment Programme. Is the Departmental authority and custodian, on behalf of the MOD Chief Scientific Adviser, of the 1958 UK/US Mutual Defence Agreement and other international nuclear Science & Technology relationships.

Name: Prof Vernon Gibson
Job/Team Function: CSA is responsible for ensuring that key strategic decisions made by Ministers, senior officials and the Armed Forces are informed by high quality expert scientific advice and analysis. He is deputy chair of MOD's R&D Board, a member of the Investment Approvals Committee and is the technical SRO for the 1958 UK-US Mutual Defence Agreement on nuclear issues. He is process owner for Science & Technology (S&T) and responsible for delivery of the S&T Programme budget, which covers both nuclear and non-nuclear S&T.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: This role advises on all scientific and technical aspects of the Department’s nuclear programmes, including sponsorship of the research and capability maintenance programme at the Atomic Weapons Establishment, nuclear safety and security, non-proliferation, nuclear propulsion and advice of radiological and nuclear defensive capabilities. The post also undertakes international collaboration with US and France, and co-operation with other international partners.

Name: Carl Newns
Job/Team Function: Provision of communications support to Ministers & Defence Board Members. Production of Communication Plans. Management of New Media. Management and Production of Policy for Media Operations. Delivery of Defence and Services PR. Delivery of Defence Internal Communication. Delivery of Communication Policy across Defence.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Authorised channel of communication with the news media. Presentational advice to Ministers, officers and officials. Briefing journalists and dealing with media inquiries. Effective rebuttal strategies. Interviews, press conferences, briefings, facilities etc. Ministerial visits and Parliamentary business. Responsible for Campaigns including events and Internal Campaigns and Communications Planning and Coordination.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Lead the development of Defence Communication Strategies, whilst ensuring coherence with Government Policy and the extant Government Communications Plan. Provide Guidance, Leadership, Advice and Direction to the following teams: Research, Insight and Evaluation, Strategy, Single Service Strategy, Digital, Brand, Internal Communications and Professionalisation.  Develop and co-ordinate delivery of timely and effective comms plans, Insight and Evaluation. Manage the MOD's programme of internal and public research on defence reputation. Responsible for the Communications Strategy for the Royal Navy, Army and Royal Air Force, Digital and Brand Strategy.

Name: Vacant
Job Title: Head of Secretariat, Business Management and Content Services
Job/Team Function: As part of the Defence Communications Change Programme, develop the future structure and management of the team delivering MOD's focal point for content posted onto Gov.uk, DDC generated imagery conent and the management of the DDC imagery database. Responsible for the future Forces broadcasting service  project and the future DIADEM project; PQ and FOI requests allocated to DDC and unit business management; and for the MOD art collection.

Name: N/D
Job Title: Head of Defence Communications Capability Programme
Job/Team Function: The Defence Communications Capability Programme is a Cabinet Office directed review of the Communications function across Defence

Name: Lt Gen Andrew Gregory
Job/Team Function: Chief of Defence People directs and coordinates Personnel Strategy for the entire Defence workforce.  By integrating the management of all personnel, whether Regular or Reserve, Civil Servants, or contractors, decisions can be taken using a ‘Whole Force Approach’, rather than in the silos that have existed in the past.  His principal role is to ensure that the right policies, strategies and legislation are in place to ensure that Defence outputs are delivered by the right mix of capable and motivated people, that reflect the breadth of society we exist to defend, now and in the future.  He reports to the Vice Chief of the Defence Staff and is responsible for advising the Defence Board on Defence People issues and the formulation of People policy.  He is the Senior Responsible Owner for the Defence Technical Training Change Programme, the New Employment Model and the Defence Diversity and Inclusivity Programme.

Name: Maj Gen Richard Nugee
Job Title: Assistant Chief of Defence Staff (Personnel Capability) / Defence Services Secretary
Job/Team Function: ACDS(Pers Cap) also has the role of Defence Services Secretary (DS Sec). The Honours and Ceremonial Division supports ACDS(Pers/Cap) in both roles. The Division has a wide portfolio focused on policy for medals and commemorations; and Royal Household business. DS Sec is a member of the Royal Household. DS Sec also manages tri-Service appointments and Senior Officer remuneration in support of CDS. The DS Sec and the Royal Household Team, support The Queen as Head of the Armed Forces and ensures effective liaison between the Royal Household and the MOD. The team has responsibility for: military manpower support; submissions; petitions; Royal patronage; and the co-ordination of Royal Visits to the Armed Forces. The Ceremonial Events and Commemorations Team, develops and implements policies and events for national recognition of Armed Forces personnel, including being responsible for tri-Service policy for the national commemoration of anniversaries of significance to the Armed Forces and the MOD, and the delivery of these events.

Name: N/D
Job Title: Head Training, Education, Skills, Recruitment and Resettlement
Job/Team Function: TESRR sets and assures the strategic policies and high-level framework that govern, guide and empower JFC, the sS and CivHR (where relevant) to Attract, Recruit, Train, Develop, Retain and Transition Defence personnel. The policy for SP resettlement and the delivery of 3rd Line resettlement (through a Public/Private partnership) is managed in TESRR.  TESRR is responsible for cohering the Training DLoD in TLCM and for the setting of strategic framework for Defence Training, Simulation and Infrastructure.  TESRR works under ACDS(PersCap) to facilitate the 3* Defence People and Training Board and enables subordinate governance and coordination arrangements.  TESRR has a strategic engagement and stakeholder influence role in order to enable the primary activities.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Responsible for defining and coordinating CDP's input into the SDSR, and for leading two concept-phase programmes to provide radical proposals for Service Personnel Terms and Conditions of Service

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Responsible for the development and promulgation of tri-Service policy for the Armed Forces on a range of non-financial terms and conditions of service plus accommodation, families and welfare issues.

Name: Heather Mcnaughton / Caroline Pusey (Job Share)
Job/Team Function: As one of the two Service Personnel Operating Officers (SPOOs) Director Service Personnel Policy directs the work of the Service Personnel Staff on behalf of CDP, and are responsible for directing the execution of the work of the Service Personnel Staff.  This includes:Chairmanship of the Service Personnel Operating Board; day-to-day prioritisation in response to events; Line management of the Heads of the policy divisions;Facilitation of the policy formulation process, through frequent dialogue with the policy divisions and their counterparts in the Services’ personnel staffs; Assurance of the quality and timeliness of work carried out by the Service Personnel Staff.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Responsible for delivering an effective, fair and appropriately resourced and targeted remuneration package to recruit and retain Service Personnel, both Regular and Reserve.  This is delivered through the development of policy and provision of advice in the areas of pay, allowances, pensions.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: The Secretariat is responsible for Parliamentary business; policy matters relating to legislation, discipline, conduct and complaints within the Armed Forces; and equality and diversity issues for the whole MOD workforce.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Responsible for Defence People strategy, analysis and research and the Programme Management of the New Employment Model (NEM)

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Provision of medical advice relating to Service Personnel Policy.

Name: Maj Gen John Crackett
Job Title: Assistant Chief of Defence Staff (Reserves & Cadets)
Job/Team Function: ACDS(R&C), the senior Reservist in Defence, reports to CDP and is responsible for developing policy for both the Reserve Forces and the Cadet Forces.  The role shapes the use of Reserve Forces in the near term as well as developing the strategic direction for reserves through interaction with a wide variety of stakeholders including the Secretary of State, Ministers and single Service Chiefs.  As one of the five 2* officers within Defence People ACDS (R&C) fulfils a key role in the wider management of Service personnel both Regular and Reserve.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Responsible for Defence Reserves policy, the delivery of Centre elements of the Future Reserves 2020 programme and for supporting VCDS and PUS in their coherence and assurance role for the programme as a whole.  The programme aims to reinvigorate the Reserve Forces and further integrate them as part of a Whole Force. The role ensures that the Reserve Forces will continue to provide capability in the future through the FR20 programme.  This requires considerable interaction with wider areas of government as well as with the single Services.

Name: Nicola Williams
Job/Team Function: The Ombudsman provides an independent oversight of how the Service complaints system is working and reports back to Ministers and to Parliament. The Commissioner also provides an alternative point of contact for Service personnel, or someone acting on their behalf, to raise concerns.

Name: Andrew Cayley
Job/Team Function: The Service Prosecuting Authority provides for the independent, efficient and consistent consideration of criminal cases and offences contrary to military discipline.  It will initiate prosecutions where justified and conduct fair and thorough proceedings in the service courts of first instance and the service appellate courts, whilst liaising effectively with the police and dealing with prosecution witnesses and victims of crime with care and sensitivity. Whilst maintaining independence from the service chain of command, the Service Prosecuting Authority fulfils its functions in support of operational effectiveness of the Armed Forces throughout the world.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Support the provision of independent, efficient and consistent consideration of criminal cases and offences contrary to military discipline.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Responsible for development of the future requirement for Defence People services delivered by DBS including performance metrics, and defining MOD requirements for Military and Civilian HR IT systems.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Head Capability and Cadets is within the Reserve Forces and Cadets directorate and responsible for MOD and tri-Service policy for Cadets and youth engagement. This includes management of the Cadet Force 2020 programme, delivery of the Cadet Expansion Programme (jointly with DfE) and implementation of the Defence Youth Engagement Review. This requires considerable interaction with the single Services and Other Government Departments.

Name: Esther Wallington
Job/Team Function: The Director for Civilian Human Resources (D Civ HR) is the Civilian Workforce Process Owner and is responsible for advising the Defence Board and Ministers on Civilian Workforce Strategy (CWS), civilian personnel policy, and employee relations, and providing assurance on the integrity of HR delivery systems. This includes responsibility for implementing the programme to reduce the size of the civilian workforce, while maintaining its effectiveness, to which the Department committed in the SDSR. D Civ HR is also responsible for supporting PUS in her role of ‘Head of Profession’ for MOD civil servants and is responsible fo rthe Change Team.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: The Principal HR Business Partner is responsible for:  providing HR insight and input into the development of the DE&S business strategy and change programme; identifying, developing, implementing and monitoring a range of HR interventions to achieve business objectives; and for ensuring the services provided to DE&S by the DBSO and Civil Service Shared Expert Services meet business needs. As well as the DE&S-specific role, and on behalf of the Process Owner, the Principal HR Business Partner provides the professional focus for the HR Business Partner function both internally within MOD and across the Civil Service.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: The Head Office Strategic HR Policy team 2 is responsible for Leadership and skills planning, and HR policies and procedures, which meet business needs, support managers to get the best from their people now and in the future, and enable the Department to manage employee relations and comply with employment and equality legislation.

Name: N/D
Job Title: Head Civilian HR Policy and Reward
Job/Team Function: Responsible for policy on civilian HR, employee relations and pay and allowances.

Name: Vacant
Job/Team Function: Provide professional advice and guidance to the Service Police to enhance the independence and effectiveness of investigations.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Responsible for Delivering the Armed Forces Act 2016 which will extend the legal basis for the Armed Foces to 2021 and make other required statutory changes to Armed Forces legislation.

Name: Air Marshal R Garwood
Job/Team Function: The Director General of the Defence Safety Authority (DG DSA) is responsible and accountable for overseeing safety in Defence.  DG DSA, on behalf of the Secretary of State, empowers suitably qualified and experienced Crown servants to be Defence Regulators in defined domain and functional areas (Aviation, Maritime, Land, Nuclear, Fire Safety and Ordnance, Munitions & Explosives). The Director General provides assurance to the Secretary of State for Defence that his policy on safety is being promoted and implemented in the conduct of Defence activities.  DG DSA is the primary Convening Authority for all Service Inquiries pertaining to safety-related fatalities, serious injuries and significant loss of major capability. DG DSA, on behalf of the Secretary of State, also empowers suitably qualified and experienced Crown servants to act as Defence Investigators for each domain in order to assist Service Inquiries.

Name: R Adm Paul Chivers
Job/Team Function: The Director of the Military Aviation Authority has full oversight of all Defence Aviation activity, and is the single regulatory authority responsible for regulating all aspects of Air Safety across Defence. He achieves this through establishing and maintaining an appropriate regulatory framework, given effect by a certification, approvals and inspection process extending across the acquisition, operation and continued airworthiness of air systems within the Defence air environment, and by independent surveillance of relevant Departmental planning and programming processes. The Director provides assurance, via DG DSA and the Second Permanent Under Secretary of State, to the Secretary of State for Defence that high standards of Air Safety are maintained in the conduct of military aviation. The Director chairs the MAA Operators’ Council (MOC) and the MAA Executive Board (MEB) and is a member of the DSA Management Board.

Name: AVM Martin Clark
Job/Team Function: Member of the MAA Executive Board.  Lead and direct the Technical Group of the MAA; technical regulatory lead with FLCs, DE&S and Industry; link to OGDs and Agencies outside Government on aviation operating matters, including international liaison.

Name: N/D
Job Title: Head Oversight & Approvals Military Aviation Authority
Job/Team Function: MAA Oversight and Approvals regulates, on behalf of DG MAA, the operation of all aircraft registered as UK Military Aircraft (manned and unmanned) covering all aerial activities of FLCs, DE&S and contractors’. MAA O&A regulation activities also extend to Military Registered Civil-Owned Aircraft (MRCOA).  In addition, a key output is the contribution to assurance of the airworthiness of aviation on the UKMR through airworthiness organisation and key individual approvals.

Name: N/D
Job Title: Head Analysis & Plans Military Aviation Authority
Job/Team Function: The maintenance and promulgation of the MoD’s through-life Airworthiness Regulations, Standards and associated publications.  Regulation and Policy publication coherence.  Take the lead for the harmonization of airworthiness across European military authorities.  Develop the MAA approach to Risk Management.  Responsible for the end-to-end output of AUP considering the full spectrum of the Military Air Environment.  Exploit Air Safety knowledge assessing performance and risk to develop an evidence based prioritized plan pan MAA.

Name: N/D
Job Title: Head Regulation & Certification Military Aviation Authority
Job/Team Function: Regulation.  The development, maintenance and promulgation of the MOD’s through-life Flying, ATM, Design and Continuing Airworthiness Regulations, Standards and associated publications; includng translation of MAA policy into the regulatory framework, regulatory review and risk assessment, and consideration of regulatory change, alternative AMC, waiver and sanction activity. Certification.  The Certification of all new UK military registered air systems and major changes to type designs, assurance of aircraft structural, propulsion and systems integrity management, the sponsorship, management and maintenance of UK aircraft design and airworthiness standards, and asurance of the safety of ships' aviation facilities.  In addition, providing SME input to the development and maintenance of regulation covering all the areas of Certification business.

Name: Vacant

Name: N/D

Name: Vacant
Job/Team Function: Director Business Resilience (DBR) is the Process Owner for Security and Business Continuity. DBR is responsible for setting policy and standards for MOD in these areas and monitoring their implementation and risk management.  Key areas of policy activity include: Security (including Physical, Defence Policing, Personnel, Industrial and Scientific & Technical) and Business Continuity. DBR also manages all aspects of common law compensation claims made against the Department.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Head of Defence Security and Resilience (DBR-DefSy) is responsible for developing, promulgating and monitoring the Department’s protective security policy and standards; advising Ministers and senior officials on the political, presentational and legal aspects of protective security policy; supporting the Director Business Resilience as Security Process Owner and in providing assurance to the DAC that security risks are being effectively addressed or managed.  Responsibilities cover personnel security (including vetting); leak investigations; policing policy & physical security (including guarding); nuclear security & safety (including nuclear accident response); and technical and international security issues (including the security relationship with industry).This role also has responsibility for Business Continuity (including pandemic flu policy and planning).

Name: N/D

Corporate customer for Defence Business Services (DBS), ensuring delivery of shared corporate services in MOD against SLA and KPIs; 4. Contract management of the DBS Managment Partner Contract.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Responsible for the assessment, award, payment and maintenance of all pensions relating to service in the Armed Forces.  These include occupational pensions (The Armed Forces Pension Schemes (AFPS)), war disablement pensions, war widows’ pensions, related allowances and other payments to service veterans.  They also administer the ex-gratia payments scheme to former prisoners of the Japanese in World War 2. Additionally, Veterans Services undertake the assessment, award and maintenance of Armed Forces Compensation Scheme (AFCS) claims plus the presentation of appeals to independent Pensions Appeal Tribunals (PAT) for both current and former Service personnel.

They provide the management and future development of IT and processes in support of serving military personnel, Reserves and Veterans in line with evolving policy.
